result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley T Sage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.
No contact with the victim or her family.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bradley T Sage
Current: 5340 Denver Street NE, St Petersburg, FL 33703 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2015)
Prior: 4060 Harbor School Rd, Egg Harbor, WI 54209

Defendant Bradley T Sage in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Defendant Bradley T Sage in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Atty Malcore asks court to amend cash bond to a signature bond to allow him to relocate back to the State of Florida. State objects to bond modification. Court feels cash is warranted, bond remains in effect as originally set.

Defendant Bradley T Sage in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Defendant Bradley T Sage in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 11:45 am.

No contact direct or indirect with S.C. or her residence at 4060 Harbor School Road, Egg Harbor.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Bradley T Sage appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
